data.title: ITV Loose Women host addresses exit after months off-air sparks show concern
data.meta_description: Loose Women star Jane Moore was noticeably absent from the panel for a special edition of the ITV show on Monday.
data.text:
Jane Moore was "missing in action" from the Loose Women panel on Monday, as the show hosted a special episode for those aged over 60, weeks after it was reported that she was embroiled in a "row" with bosses.

Ruth Langsford, 63, fronted the show, as she was joined by Linda Robson, 65, Denise Welch, also 65 and 61-year-old Kaye Adams. The hour-long episode dubbed "This Is 60" discussed everything from health concerns to feeling invisible as people age.

Jane, 61, was missing from the panel which was picked up on by numerous viewers on social media as one X user tweeted: "What about Jane Moore, she's 61."

Another queried: "Where's Jane Moore?"

It comes after reports suggested Jane and fellow co-star Janet Street-Porter had been asked to sign contracts saying they were permanent ITV employees rather than freelance journalists.

READ MORE Lorraine Kelly 'so sorry' as heartbroken ITV star confirms death of 'remarkable' [LATEST]

In a new interview with Woman's Own magazine Jane has addressed her absence and said it's been down to her busy schedule. The presenter has not been on the panel since December.

According to Yahoo UK, she told the aforementioned publication she had no plans to leave the programme.

"No, no, I'll definitely stay there. I've had a couple of months off because I've got so much other work on and I've just been on tour with Sharon Osbourne. I've had a holiday and I'll be back to Loose Women on 1 March," Jane confirmed.

She recently joined Ozzy Osbourne's wife Sharon for her nationwide tour Cut The Crap, where the former talent judge opened up about the eventful moments of her life, including her tumultuous marriage to Black Sabbath star.

This Morning viewers cry 'I'm old' as iconic TV cop duo celebrate milestone [LATEST]

Lorraine Kelly 'so sorry' as heartbroken ITV star confirms death of 'remarkable' [ITV]

We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy

The columnist also opened up about her relationship with her co-stars as the ITV panellist admitted she had a close bond with Coleen Nolan, Nadia Sawalha and broadcast legend Janet Street-Porter.

She said: "To be honest, [I get along] with all of them. I had lunch with Nadia today, and Kaye came to stay with me last week. Plus, I was just speaking to Janet on my way here, and Coleen.

"The ones I'm particularly closest to are the ones who have been there the longest, but I like and get on with everyone."

The journalist and broadcaster announced that she and her husband Gary Farrow had parted ways after more than 20 years of marriage but she has no plans to start dating again anytime soon.

Loose Women airs weekdays on ITV at 12.30pm
